result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy G Sandlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Copy of JOC mailed to defendant at 115 W. Doty Street, Madison, WI returned marked, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward.
Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to time served on 12-8-16; unpaid restitution of $463.14, court obligations of $443, and supervision fees of $480.50
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton

Defendant Timothy G Sandlin in court, in custody with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation agent Josh Champion present in court.  Cases called: 14CF144 and 14CF184.  In 14CF144 Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 year in jail.  307 days credit.  Time served sentence.  All financial obligations have been paid.  In 14CF184 Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months jail, concurrent to 14CF144.  155 days credit.  Time served.   A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligations.   10:33/10:52
